title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Advanced Rotary Wing Phase II Enhancement

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Inter-European Professional Development Seminar (IEPDS)

description.narrative: The Inter-European Professional Development Seminar (IEPDS) is designed to develop non-commissioned officers, senior non-commissioned officers, warrant officers and junior officers in a blended officer/enlisted environment to prepare them for increased leadership roles and responsibilities. The curriculum is developed from a sampling of courses offered in the 5-week IESOS and IENCOA Professional Military Education courses. After completing this course, graduates will have acquired and practiced new leadership skills such as problem solving, critical thinking, and teambuilding. These new skillsets will help them develop as leaders and as team members. Course activities will challenge students to apply newly learned principles.

title.narrative: Proliferation Security Initiative - Exercise Cutlass Express

description.narrative: The Proliferation Security Initiative (PSI) is an international cooperative effort to stop trafficking in Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD), their delivery systems, and related materials to and from state and non-state actors of proliferation concern. DoD is the U.S. Governments operational lead for the PSI and works closely with other departments/agencies to conduct and participate in PSI exercises, workshops, training events, meetings and other activities. These activities demonstrate the commitment of participants to the PSI Statement of Interdiction Principles, test national capabilities to conduct air, ground, and maritime interdictions and increase understanding of PSI globally and within geographic regions.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: Counterterrorism Partnerships Fund (CTPF) - 1st Danab Battalion

description.narrative: The Counterterrorism Partnerships Fund (CTPF) supports a sustainable and partnership-focused approach to counterterrorism with a flexible mechanism that allows the Department of Defense (DoD) to respond more nimbly to evolving terrorist threats from South Asia to the Sahel. The CTPF builds on existing tools and authorities to respond to a range of terrorist threats by providing direct support to partner nations as well as augmenting U.S. capability to support partners in counterterrorism (CT) operations.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
